item.title: Bankers in the APAC region predict a decrease in M&A activity under President Trump's administration
item.description: A recent survey of 300 Asia Pacific mergers and acquisitions (M&A) professionals conducted by Intralinks, a secure platform used by dealmakers for content sharing, found that 75% of respondents believe a potential presidency under Donald Trump would negatively impact M&A activity in the region. This mirrors the global sentiment revealed by Intralinks’ survey of 1,500 M&A professionals worldwide. Intralinks’ Global M&A Sentiment Survey shows 75% of Asian dealmakers consider Trump the most detrimental presidential candidate for M&A activity.

item.title: US airlines may now reject your standard carry-on
item.description: According to George Hobica from Airfarewatchdog, several US airlines have reduced the allowed size for carry-on luggage. Traveling Hello Kitty statue at Taoyuan Airport, Taiwan in 2008. American, Delta, and United Airlines now permit carry-on bags with a maximum size of 22 inches in length, 14 inches in width, and 9 inches in height. The previous allowed width was 15 inches. A Yahoo article from March highlighted United Airlines’ stricter enforcement of carry-on size regulations.

item.title: Australia, Singapore, and the UAE are among the top 10 destinations on people's relocation wishlist
item.description: A recent report by Hydrogen Group, a global recruitment firm, reveals a growing trend of professionals seeking international work opportunities. The study found that the number of individuals open to working abroad doubled over a five-year period, rising from 16% in 2010 to 35% in 2014. Furthermore, 40% of respondents believe there are no obstacles to relocating for work. While the US and UK were the most popular destinations, followed by Australia, Singapore ranked as the most preferred Asian country at seventh place.

item.title: Intralinks APAC respondents predict that waves in China will have an impact on M&A
item.description: Dealmakers in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region believe that China’s economic and market activity will be the biggest influence on mergers and acquisitions (M&A) in the region over the coming six months. This insight comes from a survey of over 1,600 global M&A professionals conducted by Intralinks, a leading provider of M&A deal management and secure collaboration solutions. The survey, conducted between October 4 and 11, 2016, gathered responses from dealmakers across APAC, Europe, the Middle East and Africa, North America, and Latin America.

item.title: Korean Air provides a direct flight between Seoul and Houston
item.description: Korean Air has launched new daily nonstop flights between George Bush Intercontinental Airport (IAH) in Houston and Incheon International Airport in Seoul. Source: Korean Air. The first 777-200 aircraft arrives in Houston on May 2. John Jackson, Korean Air’s Vice President of Passenger Marketing and Sales for the Americas, stated: “We see significant opportunities here and are both proud and excited to join Houston’s vibrant business community.” These nonstop flights will depart daily from Terminal D at George Bush Intercontinental Airport at 10:40 am CST, with return flights leaving Seoul at 9:10 am local time from Incheon International Airport.

item.title: Etihad announces first destinations for Airbus A380 and Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft
item.description: Etihad Airways, the national airline of the United Arab Emirates, has announced the initial destinations for its new Airbus A380 and Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft. Source: Etihad. The Boeing 787-9. The Abu Dhabi-based airline will start flying its first A380 to London’s Heathrow Airport in December 2014, with a second A380 added to the same route in the first quarter of 2015. By the end of 2015, Etihad Airways will have five A380s in service, with plans to also introduce them on routes to Sydney and New York’s JFK Airport.

item.title: Top-paying technology jobs for 2014 - for those in the United States
item.description: The 2014 Salary Guides published by Robert Half Technology and The Creative Group identify six technology and digital jobs experiencing high demand in the US. This demand may also be reflected in the Asia Pacific region. Companies are specifically seeking professionals skilled in information and network security, data analysis for business intelligence, and mobile development. “Building a strong online presence and engaging customers through mobile platforms is crucial for businesses today,” says John Reed, Senior Executive Director of Robert Half Technology and The Creative Group.

item.title: Fishbat provides commentary on the latest developments in iOS8 and the introduction of Apple Pay
item.description: Apple, the tech giant, recently launched the first beta version of iOS 8.1. This upgrade comes shortly after the release of iOS 8.0.2, which was itself a fix for a bug found in the recently launched iOS 8.0.1. This new beta version offers several new features: A redesigned icon for iBooks. An option to enable dictation within the keyboard settings. Updated application permission settings. Larger application icons specifically designed for the new widgets in the notification center.

item.title: GMC uses Instagram to showcase PanoGrams and highlight #GMCprecision
item.description: Source: GMC. GMC launched a new Instagram campaign using panoramic photography and the hashtag #GMCprecision. The month-long US campaign, which began on May 22nd, highlights the meticulous design of GMC vehicles. Using Instagram’s new Carousel format, GMC is one of the first car companies to create â€œPanoGrams." This format lets users swipe through a series of pictures in a single ad, similar to a multi-page spread in a magazine. These PanoGrams form one panoramic image and include a link to GMC’s website for further details.

item.title: Singapore Airlines expands its presence in the United States with a new codeshare agreement with Asiana Airlines
item.description: Singapore Airlines has broadened its codeshare partnership with Asiana Airlines, expanding its network beyond Seoul’s Incheon International Airport to include Honolulu, Seattle, and Los Angeles. These Star Alliance members have been codesharing on flights between Singapore and Seoul-Incheon since September 2005. Singapore Airlines currently offers four daily flights on this route, with one continuing to San Francisco, while Asiana operates daily flights. Asiana also places its code on Singapore Airlines-operated flights extending beyond Singapore to Jakarta, Indonesia; Perth, Australia; Auckland, New Zealand; and Cape Town, South Africa.

item.title: Trademarks from Asia in a world that is interconnected
item.description: Asian brands aiming to go global don’t have the luxury of slowly building a reputation over decades, according to experts who spoke at the 136th annual meeting of the International Trademark Association (INTA). This information was shared in a newsletter by IP Mirror, a company specializing in domain name registration, cloud hosting, and brand protection. Source: INTA website. The event, held in Hong Kong in early May, highlighted several strategies for Asian brands expanding globally, as reported by IP Mirror:

item.title: Foul Odor of Decaying Prepaid Calling Cards
item.description: Prepaid calling cards are a popular choice for international calls due to their incredibly low advertised rates. The cards often boast incredibly low per-minute rates, but these rates don’t tell the whole story. Like perishable food, prepaid calling cards have a limited lifespan once you start using them. Hidden in the fine print on the back of these cards are details about connection fees, minimum call durations, and weekly service fees.

item.title: Users of Didi Kuaidi, GrabTaxi, Lyft, and Ola can now utilize their apps in different countries
item.description: The concept of “roaming” has evolved from phone services to ATM cash withdrawals. Now, a partnership similar to the airline industry’s Star Alliance is bringing global roaming to ride-hailing apps that were once limited to specific regions. Didi Kuaidi, GrabTaxi, Lyft, and Ola have expanded their initial ride-sharing agreement, first established between Lyft and Didi Kuaidi in September. This expanded partnership now encompasses a significant portion of the world’s population, covering nearly all of Southeast Asia, India, China, and the United States.
